name: Dagger
headline: Develop your CI/CD pipelines as code and run them anywhere
description: Dagger is a programmable CI/CD engine that runs your pipelines in containers. Develop your pipelines as code, in the same programming language as your application. Choose your SDK and start coding! Dagger executes your pipelines entirely as standard OCI containers. This has several benefits: - Instant local testing - Portability: the same pipeline can run on your local machine, a CI runner, a dedicated server, or any container hosting service. - Superior caching: every operation is cached by default, and caching works the same everywhere - Compatibility with the Docker ecosystem: if it runs in a container, you can add it to your pipeline. - Cross-language instrumentation: teams can use each other's tools without learning each other's language.
generated_description:
### Dagger: Revolutionizing CI/CD Pipelines

**Overview:**  
Founded in 2018 and a proud member of Y Combinator's Batch W19, Dagger is a forward-thinking company located in San Francisco. With a compact yet effective team of 22 dedicated employees, Dagger is on a mission to transform the way we think about Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD). They aim to empower developers to write their CI/CD pipelines as code, making it easy to run those pipelines anywhere.

**Product Concept:**  
Dagger started as a programmable CI/CD engine, leveraging the power of containers. The revolutionary idea is that you can develop your pipelines using the same programming languages you use for your applications: Go, TypeScript, or Python. This brings a myriad of benefits:

- **Instant Local Testing:** Run your pipelines locally just as you would in production.
- **Portability:** Your pipelines can run anywhere—from your laptop to cloud CI environments.
- **Superior Caching:** Operations are cached automatically, boosting performance, and ensuring consistency across different environments.
- **Docker Compatibility:** If it runs in a container, it seamlessly integrates into your pipeline.
- **Cross-Language Instrumentation:** Teams can utilize each other's tools without needing to dive into unfamiliar languages.

**Core Features:**  
- **API-First Approach:** Dagger champions code over YAML, making complex CI scripts a thing of the past. The focus is on replacing cumbersome scripts with a more intuitive, programmable interface.
- **Standardized Modules:** Users can chain reusable Dagger functions to create efficient pipelines, built by themselves or the community.
- **High Performance:** Advanced caching techniques minimize unnecessary rebuilds and testing, accelerating delivery cycles.
- **Observability:** Gain deep visibility into your pipelines with interactive debugging tools to quickly identify and fix issues.

**Community and Resources:**  
Dagger encourages community involvement where developers can join discussions on platforms like Discord and GitHub. They offer extensive documentation, case studies, and example projects to help newcomers get started seamlessly. 

For those interested:
- **Get Started with Dagger:** [Start Here](https://dagger.io/<https:/docs.dagger.io/quickstart>)
- **Join the Community:** [Join Us](https://dagger.io/<https:/discord.gg/dagger-io>)
- **Learn More:** [Visit Dagger's Website](https://dagger.io)

**Conclusion:**  
Dagger is not just another tool in the CI/CD ecosystem; it stands out by simplifying complexity, enhancing developer experiences, and making pipelines as flexible and powerful as they should be. If your team is looking to eliminate the frustrations of "push & pray" deployments, Dagger is worth a closer look.  

For more detailed insights into its capabilities, check out the testimonials from satisfied users and see how Dagger is changing the game in CI/CD.
